author: Special Correspondent
text:
DMK leader M. Karunanidhi on Wednesday asked Chief Minister Jayalalithaa to come out with an explanation to Union Power Minister Piyush Goyal’s allegation that he was not able to discuss power projects for the State with her as she was inaccessible.

In a statement here, Mr. Karunanidhi said instead of responding directly to Mr Goyal’s charges, Ms. Jayalalithaa made two Ministers of her Cabinet to issue denials. “But the Ministers only launched personal attacks and never bothered to reply to the issues raised by Mr. Goyal,” he said.

Mr. Karunanidhi rejected the argument that Ms. Jayalalithaa had met Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Ministers eight times. “Actually she met Mr Modi immediately after he assumed office. On other occasions, Mr. Modi and others called on her in Chennai or she met them at public functions,” he said.

The Chief Minister should come out openly why she denied an appointment to Mr. Goyal.

“Another Union Minister Prakash Javadekar also has said he could not meet Ms. Jayalalithaa. I wonder whether O. Pannerselvam and Natham R. Viswanathan can get an audience with the Chief Minister,” Mr. Karunanidhi said.

“In the last five years, the AIADMK government has not implemented any scheme for the development of the State. It also failed to utilise the help rendered by the Centre,” the DMK chief alleged.
title: Karunanidhi demands explanation from Jayalalithaa on Goyal’s remarks
